title: Sources: Rockets' Adams agrees to $39M extension
content: Houston Rockets center Steven Adams has agreed to a three-year, $39 million contract extension to stay with the franchise, sources told ESPN.

title: Lynx coach: Shooting of lawmakers hits 'home'
content: Lynx coach Cheryl Reeve acknowledged it would be difficult to play Saturday's game against the Los Angeles Sparks after two Minnesota lawmakers were shot and one was killed in what Gov. Tim Walz described as "targeted political violence."

title: Sources: 5-star DE McCoy commits to Gators
content: Five-star defensive end JaReylan McCoy has committed to Florida, sources told ESPN, securing his place as the top-ranked pledge in the Gators' 2026 recruiting class after returning for a second visit in the span of three weeks.

title: Oilers to start Pickard in net for G5 vs. Panthers
content: The Edmonton Oilers will start Calvin Pickard in net when they play host to the Florida Panthers Saturday night in Game 5 of the Stanley Cup Final.

title: Sources: Knicks set for talks with Brown, Jenkins
content: The Knicks are set to begin the first stage of formal interviews for their head coaching job next week, with plans to meet with Mike Brown and Taylor Jenkins, sources told ESPN.

title: Storm grant Li's request, trade center to Wings
content: The Wings have acquired Li Yueru from the Storm after the center requested a trade in a quest for more playing time.

title: F1 formally extends Las Vegas GP through 2027
content: The Las Vegas Grand Prix and Formula 1 have officially confirmed a deal to keep racing through 2027, although both parties want to continue beyond the current decade.

title: Mertens saves 11 match points in Lib√©ma victory
content: Elise Mertens saved 11 match points before beating Ekaterina Alexandrova to reach the final of the Lib√©ma Open.

title: Panthers-Oilers Game 5 preview: Who will win pivotal showdown?
content: It's now a best-of-three for the ultimate prize. Here are key stats, players and matchups, plus betting intel.

title: Why Caitlin Clark offers the best betting value for MVP
content: With Caitlin Clark set to return to the court on Saturday, there's no better time to bet on her to win WNBA MVP than right now.

title: The NBA draft's best at 20 different traits, skills: Where Flagg, Bailey and Fears stand out
content: Best clutch player? Top on-ball defender? Elite court vision? We hand out superlatives for this year's class.

title: How George Duangmanee's second round showed the beauty and the harshness of the U.S. Open
content: Duangmanee didn't have the results any golfer would hope for. But he was still playing in the U.S. Open and was going to take the positive out of that.

title: Mega-preview: Predictions, what you need to know about all 32 teams

title: Sources: Pogba in talks to return with Monaco
content: Paul Pogba is close to ending his two-year absence from football after opening with AS Monaco over a deal with the Ligue 1 team, sources have told ESPN.

title: Mexico prez calls for no ICE action at Gold Cup
content: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum urged U.S. authorities not to conduct immigration enforcement targeting attendees of a Gold Cup match in the Los Angeles area.

title: Arise, Sir David: Beckham knighted by king
content: Manchester United and England legend David Beckham has been awarded a knighthood in King Charles' Birthday Honours list.

title: Sources: Liverpool agrees to $157M Wirtz deal
content: Liverpool have agreed to sign Bayer Leverkusen's Florian Wirtz in a deal that could rise to a British transfer record fee of ¬£116m, sources have told ESPN.

title: Boca's Costa gets U.S. visa for CWC after U-turn
content: Boca Juniors defender Ayrton Costa will be able to take part in the Club World Cup in the United States following a u-turn by U.S. immigration officials who had previously rejected his visa application, the Argentine club said on Friday.

title: Messi on CWC: Expectations different with Miami
content: Lionel Messi shared that he has different expectations with Inter Miami going into the 2025 Club World Cup than when competing previously with other teams.

title: Source: Bar√ßa set to sign keeper Garc√≠a for ‚Ç¨25m
content: Barcelona are set to sign Joan Garc√≠a after exercising the Espanyol goalkeeper's ‚Ç¨25 million ($28.9 million) release clause, a source has confirmed to ESPN.

title: Overheard at the NBA Finals: Latest buzz on the futures of KD, Giannis and the Knicks
content: What are NBA insiders saying about the biggest offseason storylines? Tim Bontemps and Brian Windhorst canvass the league.

title: Dodgers desperately need Shohei Ohtani's arm, but his bat will do -- for now
content: The state of L.A.'s injury-riddled pitching staff is alarming. But Ohtani is too valuable to rush back to the mound.

title: NFL minicamp updates: Cameron Ward throws some picks, Travis Hunter gets reps at CB and WR
content: The majority of NFL mandatory minicamps are in action this week. Our reporters have the latest from around the league.

title: NFL scouts pick 10 early sleepers for the 2026 draft: Which prospects could rise quickly?
content: We asked NFL evaluators to pick out prospects in next year's draft class who aren't being talked about enough right now. Here are 10 names to know.

title: Fouls, aggression and long shots galore: What it really means to 'get Concacafed'
content: This summer's Concacaf Gold Cup is sure to provide a lot of shenanigans, and not just for the USMNT. But what exactly makes North and Central American soccer so brutal and silly?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal's Gy√∂keres interest could push United to Osimhen
content: Manchester United will turn to Victor Osimhen if they lose out on Viktor Gy√∂keres to Arsenal. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Debunking the 'Man United tax' myth
content: Transfer chiefs have complained for years, but it's on the club to stop paying over the odds for players.

title: Bueckers, Loyd heading in different directions
content: Paige Bueckers' fantasy potential takes center stage this week while Jewell Lloyd hasn't quite lived up to expectations early in the season.

title: Verstappen vows to 'race like I always do'
content: Max Verstappen vowed to "race like I always do" despite finding himself on the verge of a one-race ban.

content: In a span of a little over two years (March 1971-May 1973) of his presence in the Council of Ministers headed by former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi,¬†Mohan Kumaramangalam had emerged as the most conspicuous Union Minister

title: Reading Day to be celebrated in schools, but libraries face neglect
content: Despite govt.‚Äôs Reading Day and Reading Week push, libraries in State‚Äôs schools remain unutilised ‚Äì primarily owing to a lack of librarians

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: Another body recovered from crash site; medical college confirms four MBBS students among victims
content: Among those killed were four MBBS students from B.J. Medical College, who were having lunch in the mess building when the tragedy struck

title: BJP and JD-(U) slam Lalu Prasad for allegedly insulting Dr. Bhimrao Ambedkar
content: The BJP media cell circulated the video of Lalu Prasad of his birthday, in which a supporter enters the room carrying the portrait of Ambedkar and places it close to Prasad‚Äôs feet

content: Meitei and Kuki-Zo groups mourn the deaths of both K. Nganthoi Sharma and Lamnunthem Singson, two cabin crew hailing from different communities, in the Air India plane crash on June 12

title: Revanth extends all out support to Telugu Film industry, urges collaboration for Telangana‚Äôs $3 trillion vision
content: The Chief Minister urged the film industry to prepare a comprehensive plan for its development and submit it to the government, assuring that all necessary support would be provided

content: Congress chief slams comments indicating that ‚Äúaccidents do happen‚Äù, in an apparent reference to the Home Minister‚Äôs earlier remarks

title: Retailers at Mahanti Fish Market oppose relocation proposal, say it will cost their livelihood
content: According to sources in the VMC, the shifting is being done to address traffic issues caused by the loading and unloading of vehicles at the market, which has reportedly become a cause of inconvenience for the public, among other reasons

title: Reset with Canada, Trump tariffs, Iran-Israel tensions to dominate as Modi leaves for 3-nation tour
content: In first visit abroad since Operation Sindoor, Modi to visit Cyprus, Canada, Croatia, attend G-7 outreach summit

title: Fear of flotsam
content: After¬†plastic¬†waste from the Liberian vessel that sank off the coast of¬†Kochi floated up to the western¬†Kanniyakumari coast, fishermen were upset at the damage it could cause to their livelihood.¬†C.¬†Palanivel Rajan¬†and¬†Shankari Nivethitha B.¬†speak to experts and members of the fishing community to understand where the fears come from. Both groups have called on the State government to undertake a study on the long-term environmental impact of this incident

title: Crash narrowly missed residential area and three hospitals, staving off a larger death toll
content: While right behind the crash site is Meghani Nagar, to its immediate right is the Military Hospital inside the Cantonment. There are two other hospitals in the vicinity i.e. the Civil Hospital, and, a little further, is the Gujarat Cancer Society Medical College

title: Not Abhishek‚Äôs only Mamata‚Äôs photos on Trinamool Martyrs‚Äô Day rally
content: Abhishek Banerjee opts out, citing absence from 1993 movement; leadership seeks to contain infighting in Birbhum ahead of rally

title: Honeymoon hit job in serene Sohra
content: A murder ‚Äî allegedly plotted in Madhya Pradesh and executed 2,250 km away in Meghalaya ‚Äî has left the people of Sohra, one of the world‚Äôs wettest places, shaken as much as the family members of the victim, Raja Raghuvanshi, in Indore. While the hill town in the northeastern State wants those who defamed its residents for a crime they did not commit to apologise, the central Indian city on the Malwa plateau seeks justice for one of its sons, report¬†Rahul Karmakar¬†and¬†Mehul Malpani

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: Last remains of crash victims begin to reach families
content: One more body retrieved from under the tail of the aircraft; two days on, no official data on deaths among medical college residents

title: Facelift for Chamundi Hills inches closer to reality under PRASHAD scheme
content: The scheme looks to meet the needs of devotees as well as tourists, and build amenities that would encourage both the groups to visit the site more¬†often

title: Preventive detention must not act as a substitute for criminal prosecution or bail: SC judgment
content: Top court rules on plea against a Kerala HC order that upheld a lower court‚Äôs order to detain a man under the Kerala Anti-Social Activities (Prevention) Act, 2007

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: Air India to provide ‚Çπ25 lakh interim payment to kin of deceased, survivors
content: This interim payment is in addition to the ‚Çπ1 crore compensation already announced by the parent company, Tata Sons, Air India said in a statement.

title: After 16 years, Tumakuru‚ÄìRayadurga rail project picks up pace; over 96% of land acquired
content: The 206-km rail line, connecting Tumakuru in Karnataka to Rayadurga in Andhra Pradesh, passes through five major sections

title: 70% elder abuse complaints in last 3 years were against family members: helpline data
content: The data shows that sons rank consistently as primary perpetrators, followed by daughters-in-law and other close relatives

title: Congress attacks government over abstaining from UNGA resolution on Gaza
content: Have we abandoned India‚Äôs consistent stand advocating for a ceasefire, peace, and dialogue, asks Mr. Kharge

title: NEET-2025: Vijayapura boy tops Karnataka
content: Compared to the previous year, the number of candidates qualified from Karnataka this year has declined

title: Baby calls for detoxification of society from fascist ideals propagated by RSS
content: What is needed parallel to a political fight is a cultural fight by democratic and secular forces to detoxify people‚Äôs minds of fascist ideals, says CPI(M) general secretary

title: Congress MP sends ‚Äòreminder‚Äô to Rajya Sabha chair on pending impeachment motion against Justice Shekhar Yadav
content: Allahabad High Court judge accused of making communal remarks; impeachment motion signed by 55 Opposition MPs in December 2024; MP also seeks Parliamentary inquiry against Justice Yashwant Varma

title: Karthik Ram Kireeti is Andhra Pradesh State topper in NEET-2025
content: He has secured 19th rank at the All-India level in the General category; five other students from the State have secured all-India level ranks below 100

title: India distances itself from SCO‚Äôs statement ‚Äòstrongly‚Äô condemning Israel‚Äôs strikes against Iran
content: In a message released soon after the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation issued the statement supporting Iran‚Äôs sovereignty, the MEA said Israel-Iran hostilities should be dealt through ‚Äòchannels of dialogue and diplomacy‚Äô

title: LDF does not need communal votes: Pinarayi
content: Chief Minister lashes out at Centre, Opposition and P.V. Anwar during byelection campaign in Nilambur

title: Monsoon lags in south-interior Karnataka, but early rains have ensured healthy reservoir levels
content: The initial spell of rains in the catchment area of the Cauvery in Kodagu, ensured a continuous inflow into the KRS which breached the 100-ft mark as early as on May 30

title: Neo-fascist regimes divert attention from crisis by targeting minorities: Prabhat Patnaik
content: Patnaik calls for progressive reforms like wealth taxes on ultra-rich and inheritance taxes on passed-down assets, stressing that only a radical rethinking of economic order can curb  rising tide of authoritarianism

title: Proposed AC temperature-control norms build on 2018 guidelines
content: In 2020, the government had mandated that all air conditioners have a default setting of 24 degrees Celsius, which is considered an optimal setting for human comfort

title: Four Maoists, including three women, killed in ongoing encounter in M.P‚Äôs Balaghat
content: Combing efforts are going on in multiple areas and the encounter will continue at least till June 15, says a top police officer

title: School toilet cleaning issue: Puttanna threatens protest over suspension of teacher
content: The MLC claims there are no attenders or cleaning staff in government schools, and a situation has arisen where teachers are sometimes compelled to clean toilets

title: 11 Air India crash victims identified through DNA; families begin collecting remains
content: Describing DNA matching as a ‚Äúmeticulously slow process,‚Äù Dr. Rajnish Patel, Head of Surgery, Ahmedabad Civil Hospital, added, ‚ÄúWe need to carry it out with utmost care and precision.‚Äù

title: Telangana objects to Centre asking A.P. to submit DPR of Banakacherla project by month-end
content: Minister for Irrigation N. Uttam Kumar Reddy terms the project a violation of the provisions of APRA and GWDT, urges Centre to reject PFR/DPR

title: KC(M) steps up outreach ahead of local body polls
content: Party is ramping up its outreach efforts in central Travancore by hosting a series of seminars and symposiums to highlight pressing social issues of the region

title: Rubber Board to fill vacant posts amid staff shortage; farmers cautiously optimistic
content: Union Ministry of Commerce and Industry grants approval for the appointment of 97 new staff members, including 46 field officers and 29 scientists across three categories

title: Inter-State gang of burglars held in Madanapalle, valuables worth ‚Çπ20 lakh recovered
content: The six-member gang has been involved in burglaries that targeted locked houses and residences at isolated stretches along the highways in Madanapalle and Kurabalakota mandals

title: Death of tribal woman in Idukki found to be  case of murder
content: Initial inference was that Seetha, 42, a resident of Thottappura under the Murinjapuzha forest station, was killed in a wild elephant attack at the Meenmutty reserve forest area on Friday

title: Living donor transplants thrive as Kerala turns its face away from deceased donor organ donations
content: Of all the organ donations that had taken place in the State in the last five years, less than 10% constituted deceased donor organ donation. Resolving all systemic issues and taking government doctors into confidence can help save more lives, say experts.

title: West Godavari District Collector orders probe against 17 private hospitals for collecting extra fees under NTR Vaidya Seva Trust
content: A fine will imposed against the hospitals and further action will be initiated in the case of treating the patients by registering fake disease profile, she says

title: Ayyampuzha panchayat to appoint shooter to cull wild boars
content: The panchayat sourced a list of licensed shooters from the Aluva tahsildar, which will soon be placed before the committee for final selection

title: 47 Tamil medium students now will be part of midday meal scheme in Idukki
content: They are the students of Udumbanchola Government High School. The upper primary section functioning in the school did not have a government approval, so the students were ineligible for the scheme

title: J&K L-G reopens 16 tourist destinations closed after Pahalgam attack
content: Eight spots each from Jammu and Kashmir regions reopened; L-G Sinha announces phased re-opening of remaining destinations

title: Karnataka High Court directs State Home Secretary to mandate all educational institutions, health establishments, business entities to report engagement with foreign nationals to FRRO
content: All existing foreign nationals currently associated with these institutions/establishments must be audited and verified, the court says

title: Iran-Israel conflict: Can Netanyahu dethrone Ayatollah's regime?
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu declared strikes on Iran, targeting nuclear and military sites, aiming to disrupt Iran's nuclear program and potentially weaken the ruling regime. These actions, beyond nuclear facilities, targeted military commanders and nuclear experts, potentially destabilizing the Iranian government.

title: ‚ÄòNo Kings‚Äô protests: Anti-Trump rallies erupt across US as military parade looms
content: Across the U.S., tens of thousands protested President Trump's leadership under the 'No Kings' banner, coinciding with the Army's 250th anniversary and his birthday. Rallies occurred in nearly 2,000 locations, from cities to small towns, denouncing Trump's 'authoritarian actions' and recent federal immigration raids.

title: India's intra-squad game: Sarfaraz Khan slams century as Bumrah goes wicketless
content: Sarfaraz Khan showcased his impressive form with a rapid century for India A against the Indian Test squad in a warm-up match, scoring 101 off 76 balls. Despite his explosive innings, Jasprit Bumrah had a quiet outing, remaining wicketless. India A ended Day 2 at 299/6, trailing India's 459, with contributions from Siraj and Prasidh Krishna with the ball.

title: World's second richest man: Jeff Bezos loses world‚Äôs No. 2 spot after 8 years
content: Larry Ellison surpassed Jeff Bezos to become the world's second-richest person, driven by a $26 billion surge in his net worth following Oracle's strong earnings report. Ellison's total wealth reached $243 billion, exceeding Bezos' $227 billion and Zuckerberg's $239 billion. Elon Musk remains the wealthiest individual with $407.3 billion.

title: UN Ocean Conference: High seas treaty closer to global law; India pledges ratification
content: The UN Ocean Conference concluded in Nice, France, emphasizing the 'High Seas Treaty' to protect marine biodiversity in international waters. India pledged to ratify the treaty soon and proposed a 10-point roadmap for sustainable ocean governance. The conference also highlighted growing calls for a precautionary pause on deep-sea mining, reflecting a global commitment to ocean health.

title: Startup reality: GitHub CEO warns founders; AI can‚Äôt replace developers
content: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke cautioned startup founders that while AI coding assistants facilitate initial launches, scaling requires human developers and technical expertise. He highlighted that AI-built startups often lack the complex systems needed to attract significant investment. Dohmke stressed the importance of coding skills and knowing when to leverage AI versus relying on personal abilities for efficient development.

title: 'Best innings ever by a South African': KP hails Markram as Proteas win WTC
content: Kevin Pietersen lauded Aiden Markram's century against Australia at Lord's as South Africa's greatest Test innings. Markram's 136 guided the Proteas to a five-wicket victory in the World Test Championship final, ending their 27-year ICC title drought. Kagiso Rabada and Dale Steyn also praised Markram's composure and the team's overall performance in securing the historic win.

title: Workplace warning: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon to managers; Fire those who ‚Ä¶
content: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon has advised managers to prioritize a positive workplace culture by firing employees and even customers who exhibit toxic behavior. Dimon emphasized that removing disruptive individuals, regardless of their contributions, is crucial for fostering a respectful and effective environment. He also mentioned his retirement is still several years away.

title: 'Path to Tehran is open': Netanyahu says Israel will strike 'every site' in Iran
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has issued a stark warning to Iran, threatening strikes on "every target" of the regime and claiming a "real blow" to its nuclear infrastructure. This escalation follows Israeli airstrikes on Iranian military and nuclear sites, prompting retaliatory missile attacks on Israeli cities. The intensifying conflict has sparked global alarm as both nations appear resolute in their campaigns.

title: IND vs ENG: Old guard out, new 'leaders' in - Comparing India's 2021 & 2025 Test squads
content: India's 2025 Test squad in England signals a generational shift, contrasting sharply with the experienced 2021 team under an experienced Virat Kohli. Led by Shubman Gill, the new side lacks veteran presence due to retirements. While the bowling attack retains key figures like Bumrah and Jadeja, depth is a concern.

title: ‚ÄòBest deal India has ever offered‚Äô: India-UK trade pact seen as landmark win
content: UK Business and Trade Secretary Jonathan Reynolds highlighted the Free Trade Agreement with India as a significant economic victory, potentially boosting bilateral trade by GBP 25.5 billion annually. Reynolds emphasized the competitive advantage for the UK in advanced manufacturing sectors like automotive and machinery.

title: US lawmaker assassinated ahead of Trump parade as protestors gather nationwide
content: Amidst nationwide protests against a military parade coinciding with Trump's birthday, two Democratic lawmakers in Minnesota were shot, one fatally, by an assailant posing as a cop. Governor Walz called it a politically-motivated assassination. Earlier, Senator Padilla was detained while questioning Homeland Security. Despite easing deportations, tensions remain high, with critics denouncing the parade as a self-aggrandizing display.

title: Bengaluru stampede: BCCI forms committee; to draft celebration guidelines
content: Following the tragic stampede in Bengaluru after Royal Challengers Bengaluru's IPL victory, the BCCI is establishing standard guidelines for post-match celebrations. A three-member committee, led by Devajit Saikia, has been formed to create comprehensive guidelines within 15 days. These guidelines will address crowd control, stadium capacity, emergency protocols, and coordination with local authorities to prevent future incidents.

title: 'Tehran no longer immune': Israel says it has air superiority over Iran, can strike freely
content: Israel claimed aerial freedom over Tehran after a large-scale strike involving over 70 fighter jets, targeting Iran's nuclear program and military sites. The operation, which lasted over two hours, aimed to dismantle Iran's military and nuclear capabilities, asserting that Tehran is now exposed to Israeli strikes. Israel stated the strikes will delay Iran's nuclear program by years.

title: 'Found calm in storm': SA end ICC trophy drought; what legends said after historic win
content: South Africa secured their first ICC trophy in 27 years, winning the World Test Championship at Lord's. Cricket legends like AB de Villiers and Sachin Tendulkar lauded the team's character and Temba Bavuma's leadership. Aiden Markram's century and his crucial partnership with Bavuma were pivotal in the victory against Australia.

title: Happy father's day: 100+ messages, greetings, wishes, images, and quotes
content: Father's Day, celebrated on the third Sunday of June, honors fathers and their influence. Originating in 1909 with Sonora Smart Dodd, it's a time for families to show appreciation through gifts, quality time, and heartfelt gestures. Messages, greetings, and quotes express love and gratitude, acknowledging fathers as heroes, role models, and sources of strength and guidance.

title: Great news! Waitlisted train passengers to know status 24 hours before departure
content: Indian Railways is piloting a new initiative to release train ticket confirmation status 24 hours before departure, replacing the current 4-hour window. This aims to reduce uncertainty for waitlisted passengers, allowing for better travel planning, especially for those traveling longer distances.

title: ICC approves major changes: ODI ball rule revised, stricter concussion protocols
content: The ICC has revamped playing conditions for men's international cricket, effective mid-June and July. A key change in ODIs involves using two new balls only until the 34th over, aiming to balance bat and ball. Stricter concussion substitute rules now require teams to pre-name five role-specific replacements.

title: Fire for fire: 'Tehran will burn', warns Israel after missile barrage from Iran
content: Tensions escalate as Israel warns Iran that Tehran will "burn" if missile attacks on Jerusalem persist, following casualties and injuries. Iran retaliated with a barrage of missiles and drones, triggering sirens and explosions across Israeli cities. Netanyahu vowed to neutralize the Iranian threat, raising fears of a full-scale war despite international calls for restraint.

title: WTC Final: South Africa end 27-year ICC trophy drought; make history at Lord's
content: South Africa clinched a historic World Test Championship victory against Australia at Lord's, ending a 27-year ICC trophy drought. Chasing 282, the Proteas, led by Aiden Markram's unbeaten century and Temba Bavuma's resilient 87, secured a five-wicket win.

title: Returning to normalcy: J&K to reopen key tourist sites after Pahalgam attack
content: Following security assessments after the April 22 Pahalgam attack, Jammu and Kashmir lieutenant governor Manoj Sinha announced the phased reopening of parks and tourist destinations. Eight popular spots in the Kashmir Valley, including Beetab Valley, Verinag, and Badamwari Park, are among the first to welcome tourists again. A similar reopening process is underway in the Jammu region, with eight destinations set to reopen soon.

title: Memes break internet: Bavuma leads SA to their first ICC trophy in 27 years; beat AUS in WTC Final
content: Temba Bavuma captained South Africa to a historic ICC victory after 27 years. South Africa defeated Australia by five wickets at Lord's. Kagiso Rabada's nine wickets and Aiden Markram's century were crucial. Rabada surpassed Allan Donald as South Africa‚Äôs fourth-highest Test wicket-taker. The team celebrated the win as a culmination of years of frustration. Kyle Verreynne hit the winning shot.

title: 'Marriage ah?': Anirudh laughs off wedding buzz with Kavya; says 'chill out'
content: Amidst swirling rumours of a wedding with Sunrisers Hyderabad co-owner Kavya Maran, music composer Anirudh Ravichander has firmly denied the claims. Anirudh took to social media to dismiss the speculation, clarifying that the marriage reports are unfounded. While addressing the marriage rumours, he remained silent on the dating speculations that arose from alleged sightings with Kavya Maran.

title: 'Historic blunder': Himanta attacks Cong for letting Pak becoming nuclear state
content: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma criticized the Congress party for allegedly allowing Pakistan to become a nuclear power, claiming it now uses "nuclear blackmail." Sarma stated that India had the chance to eliminate Pakistan's nuclear threat in the 1980s, with support from the military and intelligence, but Indira Gandhi hesitated.

title: Watch: Maharaj in tears; SA beat Australia to end ICC trophy drought
content: South Africa clinched their first ICC trophy in 27 years, defeating Australia in a thrilling World Test Championship Final at Lord's. Aiden Markram's composed 136 anchored the chase, while Keshav Maharaj's emotional reaction highlighted the significance of the victory. The Proteas chased down 282, marking the second-highest successful chase at Lord's, sparking jubilant celebrations.

title: Publish Boeing report immediately: Whistleblower's lawyer to US FAA
content: Following the Air India crash involving a Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner in Ahmedabad, attorneys for Boeing whistleblower Sam Salehpour are urging the FAA to release its findings on alleged structural defects in Boeing's 787 aircraft. Salehpour had previously raised concerns about the integrity of Boeing's 787 and 777 planes, prompting an FAA investigation.

title: Watch: Iran breaches Iron Dome, strikes Israel's 'Pentagon' in Tel Aviv
content: In a significant escalation of the ongoing conflict, Iran launched a retaliatory strike targeting Israel's Kirya compound in Tel Aviv, a critical military site housing the IDF's general staff and defence ministry. Reports indicate that a barrage of Iranian missiles struck deep into Israel's defence infrastructure, causing significant damage.

title: WTC Final: Australia lose first ICC final after 15 years; go down to South Africa
content: South Africa defeated Australia in the World Test Championship final at Lord's, ending Australia's decade-long unbeaten streak in ICC tournament finals. This defeat marks only Australia's fourth loss in 14 global finals over 50 years.

title: Onstage drama: Kamal Haasan loses cool after man gifts him a sword - video
content: Actor Kamal Haasan faced an awkward moment at a party meeting in Chennai. A man gifted him a sword on stage, leading to a brief commotion. Haasan appeared visibly displeased and asked the man to put the sword down. Meanwhile, Haasan is embroiled in a controversy in Karnataka. The Karnataka High Court addressed his remarks about the Kannada language. He claimed Kannada originated from Tamil, sparking outrage.

title: Why Sir David Beckham was an underrated footballer
content: ‚ÄãFor United fans of the current vintage, it‚Äôs hard to forget how good Beckham and his mates were and how terrifying it was for opposing teams when they played together. Because at that moment we were all in a Gurinder Chadha film, hoping to bend it like Beckham and if we couldn‚Äôt copy his mohawk hairstyle, much to the chagrin of mothers and teachers.

title: Air India crash: One more body recovered from AI-171 wreckage
content: The Air India AI-171 crash in Ahmedabad has claimed over 270 lives, marking India's worst aviation disaster. The Dreamliner, en route to London, crashed shortly after takeoff, hitting a medical college campus. Recovery efforts continue, with DNA matching underway to identify victims.

title: WTC Final: Hazlewood‚Äôs flawless finals streak ends; Australia fall to SA
content: Josh Hazlewood's unblemished record in major cricket finals came to an end as South Africa defeated Australia in the 2025 ICC World Test Championship final at Lord's. Despite Hazlewood's efforts with both ball and bat, including a crucial 59-run partnership, South Africa chased down the target, securing their first WTC title and ending Australia's reign.

title: IND vs ENG: Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy launch postponed; out of respect for crash victims
content: The launch of the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy, intended to replace the Pataudi Trophy for India-England Test series in England, has been postponed. This decision follows the devastating plane crash in Ahmedabad, which claimed over 275 lives. The ECB and BCCI jointly decided to defer the ceremony out of respect for the victims.

title: UK Moves Jets To Mideast For Regional Security As Iran, Israel Trade Missiles
content: Britain is moving additional military assets, including fighter jets, to the Middle East to provide support across the region, Prime Minister Keir Starmer told reporters on Saturday as he was en route to a Group of Seven meeting in Canada.

title: Satellite Images Show Damage At Iran's Nuclear Site After Israel Strikes
content: Satellite imagery released by Maxar Technologies revealed detailed visual evidence of the destruction caused by Israel's Operation Rising Lion against Iran, a targeted military operation to roll back the Iranian threat of nuclear weapons.

title: 1st Responder Was Having Lunch At Hostel Where Air India Plane Crashed
content: An ambulance driver saw the lone survivor of the crashed AI171 aircraft walking from the plane and then attempting to go back to save his relative on board.

title: Tej Pratap Seen In Video Inside Kashi Temple's Restricted 'Red Zone', Probe Ordered
content: The Kashi Vishwanath Temple administration has ordered an investigation after a video circulating on social media purportedly showing Lalu Prasad Yadav's son and former Bihar minister Tej Pratap Yadav inside the temple's restricted 'Red Zone'.

title: 'It's Nothing Compared With What's Coming': Israel on Strikes On Iran
content: Israel pounded Iran for a second day on Saturday and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said its campaign would intensify dramatically, while Tehran called off nuclear talks that Washington had held out as the only way to halt the bombing.

title: Ahmedabad Plane Crash Live: DNA Samples Of 19 Victims Matched, Toll Reaches 274
content: Ahmedabad Air India Plane Crash Live Updates: At least 274 people were killed in one of India's deadliest plane crashes involving a London-bound Air India flight in Ahmedabad earlier this week.

title: Rape Survivor, Parents Refuse Abortion Consent, High Court Disposes Of Petition
content: The Madhya Pradesh High Court has disposed of a petition about the delay in the termination of the pregnancy of a rape survivor after the girl and her parents refused to give their consent for the procedure.

title: Elon Musk's Neuralink Device Helps Monkey See Something That's Not There
content: Elon Musk's Neuralink Corp used a brain implant to enable a monkey to see something that wasn't physically there, according to an engineer, as it moves toward its goal of helping blind people see.

title: What To Know About Iran's Nuclear Sites
content: Israel attacked multiple Iranian nuclear and military sites as tensions reached new heights over Tehran's rapidly advancing nuclear program.

title: Newly-Wed UP Man Tortures Wife With Cigarette Burns Over Dowry, Case Filed: Cops
content: Barely two days after getting married, a man in Bhadohi district here allegedly assaulted his wife regularly with cigarette burns over dowry demands while his father and sister also assaulted her, the police said on Saturday.

title: 2 Months After Pahalgam Attack, J&K Tourist Spots To Start Reopening From Tuesday
content: Jammu and Kashmir Lt Governor Manoj Sinha has announced the reopening of several tourist spots in the Union Territory in a phased manner from next week.

title: Flight Attendant, Influencer, Family's Heartbeat: 26-Year-Old Who Died In Crash
content: She was the heartbeat of her house and very popular on social media too. The 26-year-old was a flight attendant with Air India and her life, which had already taken off and was cruising at a high altitude, was about to soar even higher.

title: NDTV Exclusive: Close Call For Musk's SpaceX Rocket: How ISRO Helped Avert Space Disaster
content: The timely detection of a "crack in an oxidizer line" in the first stage of the Falcon-9 rocket - which will take four astronauts, including India's Shubhanshu Shukla, to the International Space Station - averted a major disaster.

title: Israeli Drone Strikes Refinery In Iran Gas Field: Report
content: An Israeli drone has struck a refinery in Iran's South Pars gas field Saturday, semiofficial Iranian news agencies reported.

title: US-Iran's Next Round Of Nuclear Talks Called Off After Israel Strikes: Oman
content: Oman's foreign minister says planned talks between Iran and the United States over Tehran's rapidly advancing nuclear program "will not now take place" after Israel's strikes targeting the Islamic Republic.

title: Huge Fire Breaks Out At 67-Storey Building In Dubai, 3,800 People Evacuated
content: A massive fire broke out in a 67-storey building in Marina here, the Dubai Media Office (DMO) said on Saturday.

title: Minnesota Lawmaker Killed, Another Shot At, Trump Condemns "Terrible Shooting"
content: The shootings happened at a time when political leaders nationwide have been attacked, harassed and intimidated during a time of deep political divisions.

title: He Posted 'Thank You' Note On Social Media For UK Trip, Died In Crash
content: Badruddin Halani, of a renowned business family from Gujarat's Anand, was one among the 241 people on the plane who died in the crash.

title: "Brilliant, Disciplined": Professor Remembers Co-Pilot Of Plane That Crashed
content: "Very difficult for me to digest the news," a professor of Clive Kunder, the co-pilot of the ill-fated Air India Ahmedabad-London flight, broke down as she remembered her "brilliant and disciplined" student.
